alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 5:54PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF GREEN MOUNTAINS AND RATTLESNAKE RANGE...CASPER MOUNTAIN...AND NATRONA COUNTY LOWER ELEVATIONS... HAZARDS...One band of heavy snow across Natrona County will push out of the Casper area by around 615 PM, and continue to impact the rest of eastern Natrona County through about 645 PM. In wake of this area of heavy snow, there is another band of heavy snow. These areas of heavy snow can rapidly reduce visibility to around a quarter mile. Snow rates of 1 to possible 2 inches an hour are possible. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 550 PM MDT, the second band of heavy snow was across extreme southeast Fremont into extreme southwest Natrona County moving northeast at 35 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE BETWEEN... Casper and Waltman by around 7 PM MDT This area of heavy snow could last between 1 1/2 to 2 hours. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 187 and 190. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
